timeline.message:
[BESU-184] Update picocli to 4.1.4.

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

[BESU-184] update picoCli to v.4.1.4

Ordering of usage information is not 100% backwards compatible between 3.9.6 and 4.0.0

Options utilising Collectors now go through the default factory methods changed in v.4.0.0

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText: what is the actual difference here?
timeline.author: macfarla
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -52,10 +52,10 @@
           + System.lineSeparator()
           + "This command outputs the node public key. Default output is standard output."
           + System.lineSeparator()
-          + "      --to=<FILE>   File to write public key to instead of standard output"
-          + System.lineSeparator()
           + "  -h, --help        Show this help message and exit."
           + System.lineSeparator()
+          + "      --to=<FILE>   File to write public key to instead of standard output"
+          + System.lineSeparator()

replies.bodyText: basically the --to goes below help now because of ordering of the new picoCli
replies.author: rolfyone

timeline.author: usmansaleem

timeline.message:
[BESU-184] changes per review comments.

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText: This logic is already been performed in CommandLine.defaultFactory().create(cls) ... whats the point of repeating it here?
timeline.author: usmansaleem
